pokedex module

class src.pokedex.Bulbasaur[source]

Bases: StarterPokemon

Bulbasaur is a dual-type Grass/Poison Pokémon introduced in Generation I. It evolves into Ivysaur starting at level 16, which evolves into Venusaur starting at level 32. Along with Charmander and Squirtle, Bulbasaur is one of three starter Pokémon of Kanto available at the beginning of Pokémon Red, Green, Blue, FireRed, and LeafGreen.

class src.pokedex.Charmander[source]

Bases: StarterPokemon

Charmander is a Fire-type Pokémon introduced in Generation I. It evolves into Charmeleon starting at level 16, which evolves into Charizard starting at level 36. Along with Bulbasaur and Squirtle, Charmander is one of three starter Pokémon of Kanto available at the beginning of Pokémon Red, Green, Blue, FireRed, and LeafGreen. .. note:

Charmeleon and Charizard are fire-type Pokémon, but Mega Charizard X and
Gigantamax Charizard are also Flying Pokémon, while Mega Charizard Y is a
Dragon-type Pokémon.
class src.pokedex.Squirtle[source]

Bases: StarterPokemon

Squirtle is a Water-type Pokémon introduced in Generation I. It evolves into Wartortle starting at level 16, which evolves into Blastoise starting at level 36. Along with Bulbasaur and Charmander, Squirtle is one of three starter Pokémon of Kanto available at the beginning of Pokémon Red, Green, Blue, FireRed, and LeafGreen.

class src.pokedex.StarterPokemon[source]

Bases: object

This class defined one of the starter Pokémon given to the player by Professor Oak at the start of Pokémon Red, Green, Blue, FireRed, and LeafGreen. Actual Pokémon can be created by calling the specific classes defining the starter Pokémon types. You can see more details about them at starter.

who_is_that_pokemon()[source]

Shows the Pokémon name and its evolution. Usage: .. doctest:

>>> import pokedex
>>> friend = pokedex.Bulbasaur()
>>> friend.who_is_that_pokemon()
This pokemon is Bulbasaur.
It will evolve into Ivysaur, Venusaur, Mega Venusaur, Gigantamax Venusaur.
>>>
